Question
========

A pharmaceutical company states that 30% of patients taking a new allergy medication feel drowsy. To verify this statement, 450 randomly selected people are asked to take this medication. We measure X is the number of people who feel sleepy. The probability that 160 or more people in the sample feel sleepy can be written as:

Answerlist
----------

* P(X ≥ 0.30)
* P(X ≥ 0.36)
* P(X ≥ 0.36)
* P(X ≥ 160)
* P(160 ≤ X≤ 450)

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* P(X ≥ 0.30): Incorrect
* P(X ≥ 0.36): Incorrect
* P(X ≤ 0.36): Incorrect
* P(X ≥ 160): Correct
* P(160 ≤ X≤ 450): Incorrect
